snippet: The Russian government has announced that it will sell a 7.6 percent stake in the country's largest lender, Sberbank, in a rights offering that could raise around $5.1 billion.
abstract: The Russian government has announced that it will sell a 7.6 percent stake in the country's largest lender, Sberbank, in a rights offering that could raise around $5.1 billion.

headline.main: Sberbank of Russia Starts $5.1 Billion Share Sale
headline.print_headline: Russia to Raise $5 Billion in Sberbank Stake Sale
